p: Children of all ages are susceptible but have experienced a lower incidence of COVID-19 disease. Data from the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention suggest that less than 1% of the 72,314 cases reported in China were in children under the age of 10 years, with a median age of approximately 7 years (range of 1â€“18 years) [ 6]. Data from around 150,000 laboratory-confirmed COVID-19 cases in the United States indicate that 2,572 (1.7%) cases were among children under the age of 18 years. The median age for all infected children was 11 years (with a range from 0 to 17 years of age) [ 8]. Males were more frequently infected than females in all pediatric age groups. Mortality was very unusual [ 6, 8].
